name: Bike Patrol
description: Focuses its efforts on the safety of the Greenbelt, parks, and downtown areas.

name: Patrol Unit
description: Responds to all emergency and other calls for service in the City.  This unit includes patrol officers as well as community service specialists.

name: Bike Patrol
description: Police patrol and community engagement on bicycles

name: Patrol Operations
description: Respond to calls for service (emergency and non-emergency), investigate and prevent criminal activity, perform traffic safety efforts, and enforce local, state and federal laws.

name: Bike Patrol
description: Supplements Field Operations with bike patrols, assists with special events as needed

name: Patrol City for strays.
description: Randomly drive City streets looking for stray dogs. This is usually done in areas that are known to have stray dog issues.

name: Non-Directed Patrol Response & Operations
description: Officers are expected to proactively police our community and identify education, prevention, deterrence and accountability opportunities:  Traffic Stops, Crash Reduction, Warrant Arrest, Subject Stops, Self-Initiated Field Activity, Actionable Intelligence Reporting, Hot Stop Policing, Policing Through Environmental Design, Business Checks, Community Engagement, ...etc.

name: Bike Patrol
description: Our Bike Patrol Program supplements our patrol division with added resources focused in our downtown and canal park areas during our tourist season.  This program has proven to be a valuable community resource during our spring and summer months.  Bike patrol officers can navigate and respond to calls for service much faster and efficiently than officers in vehicles.  We get approximately 3.7 million visitors to Duluth during our tourist season.

name: Bicycle Patrol Team
description: Train, equip, and deploy police officers on bicycle patrol. Bicycle officers are tasked with response to calls for service and community/problem oriented policing responsibilites.

name: Mounted Patrol
description: The Ferndale Police Department has assigned officers to work cooperatively with the Detroit Police Mounted Unit. Officers from Detroit, Ferndale, and W.S.U. will share resources to provide law enforcement and community engagement services to our community. on horseback.

name: Patrol Supervision and Administration
description: Supervision of the Patrol Personnel. Initial Review and Approval of Case Reports. Scene Management. Patrol Related Administrative Duties.

name: Patrol Shift Supervision
description: Supervise officers in the field, act as shift commander when LT is off. Read and approve case reports, issue follow up investigations, scheduling/shift staffing, mentor officers, Answer calls for service.

name: Preventative Patrol
description: Attempt to eliminate opportunity for misconduct through police presence in areas of expected crime

name: Patrol
description: Pro-active sign enforcement, being present throughout the community.

name: Patrols/Traffic Enforcement
description: Police patrols and Traffic Enforcement

name: Patrol Teams 1-6
description: Provide police service 24/7, response to over 52,000 911 and non-emergency calls for service.  Provide proactive police services concentrating on crime prevention and reduction, traffic safety, and community outreach.

name: Volunteer Parking Patrol
description: Managing, training, and tracking the 10 + volunteers that provide education, compliance, and enforcement throughout the City.  Primary focus is handicap parking.

name: Police Patrol - Animal Control
description: The Animal Control program includes the response of Animal Control officers (ACO) to various types of calls for service concerning domestic animals and wildlife (cruelty, neglect, loose, bites, aggressive, barking, animals to go, sick, dead, etc.).  This program includes patrolling of parks, dog parks, & greenways (as time permits); initial & follow-up investigations; enforcement of animal related municipal ordinances and state statutes; impoundment of/care for loose, injured, abandoned, or sick animals; working/contracting with local business (ie. Humane Society, Greenwood Wildlife, Reptile Humane, Aspen, etc.); working with pet owners and neighbors to resolve problems/disputes: and testifying in court.  Additionally, ACOs engage in educationally programs, pet licensing maintenance and enforcement, as well as community presentations.

name: Patrol
description: Answering calls for service, proactive policing, vacation watch service, and parking exemptions.

name: Patrol
description: Traditional policing operation. Responding to calls for service.

name: Directed Patrol Response & Operations
description: Officers are responsible for the initial response to all calls dispatched by the 911 emergency communication center.

name: Patrol Operations
description: Respond to calls for service (emergency and non-emergency) investigate and privent criminal activity, conduct traffic safety efforts,  enforce local and state laws and address quality of life issues.

name: Patrol Operations
description: Patrol operations emergency response units, including general Patrol Operations, Explosive Disposal Unit, Street Crimes Unit, Traffic Safety Unit, K-9 Unit, SWAT team, and Crisis Negotiation Team, Youth Resource Officers, Airport, and Parks police personnel.

name: Patrol Operations
description: Patrol operations conducts uniformed proactive criminal patrol, performs the initial review of most criminal cases, and authors the first report.. Patrol operations responds to calls for service (emergency and non-emergency), investigates traffic crashes and continuously engages our community.

name: Patrol operations
description: Patrol the city proactively when available. Answer calls for service from citizens. Complete reports on crimes, accidents etc.

name: Patrol & Patrol Support
description:
Responds to calls for service that include, but not limited to, accidents, theft, burglary, robbery, property damage, check welfare, domestic violence, medical, etc. This includes report writing and follow-up investigation. Attempt to eliminate opportunity for misconduct through police presence in areas of expected crime.

Patrol Officers specially trained in disciplines that support the critical missions of Patrol and or Investigations. Responsible for critical assignments such as schools, mental health support, and assistance during critical incidents. These support operations include School Resource Officers (SRO), Mental Health Team (MHT), Patrol Shift Investigators (PSI), Crisis Response Team (CRT), and Police Service Dogs (PSD).

Responsible for enforcing state law and city code regarding animals. Assists police and other departments with enforcement and safety issues

name: Patrol Supervision
description:
Assign and supervise all Highway maintenance and construction projects.

Make regular inspections of state and county roads; schedule repairs as needed.  Prepare daily reports on work distribution.

Schedule necessary equipment, tools and materials for delivery of maintenance work.  Available 24/7/365 for emergency procedures.

name: Patrol Operations
description: Response to calls for service in Marathon County.

name: Patrol Calls for Service - Emergency
description: Patrol response to emergency calls for service

name: Patrol Calls for Service - Non-Emergency
description: Patrol response to non-emergency calls for service

name: Patrol Services
description: Proactive and reactive activity to include responding to calls for service, grid patrols, and traffic stops.

name: Airport Additional Patrols
description: Patrols and supplies - traffic patrols, lobby patrols, bike patrols, concourse patrols, terminal patrols

name: District 1 - Bike Patrol Response
description: Bicycle officers maintain a high profile in business areas and other City hot spots to proactively enforce State and local ordinances., The Unit regularly focuses its efforts based on intelligence-led policing.

name: Patrol Supervision
description:
Assign and supervise all maintenance and construction
Make regular inspection of state and county roads and make repairs as needed
Prepare daily reports on work distribution
Provide necessary equipment, tools, and materials for delivery of maintenance work.  Available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week for emergency procedures.

name: General Patrol Operations
description: Operations related to routine patrol not dedicated to other specific law enforcement and police functions.

name: Preventive Patrol
description: Attempt to eliminate opportunity for misconduct through police presence in areas of expected crime utilizing different patrol tactics and strategies including preventative police patrol, team policing high visibility and low visibility patrol for the prevention of crime, enforcement of all laws, the arrest and prosecution of criminals and the protection of life and property.  Actively search for wanted individuals.
